elements.title: Real-time in-situ magnetization reprogramming for soft robotics
elements.contents:
Real-time in-situ magnetization reprogramming for soft robotics

  • Xianqiang Bao
  • Fan Wang
  • Metin Sitti
Article04 Aug 2025

elements.title: Direct identification of Ac and No molecules with an atom-at-a-time technique
elements.contents:
Direct identification of Ac and No molecules with an atom-at-a-time technique

Mass number measurements of the molecular species produced when ions of actinium (Ac) and nobelium (No) are exposed to trace amounts of H2O and N2 demonstrate direct species identification using an atom-at-a-time technique for heavy elements.

  • Jennifer L. Pore
  • Jacklyn M. Gates
  • Sarah Sprouse
Article04 Aug 2025

elements.title: Flourishing chemosynthetic life at the greatest depths of hadal trenches
elements.contents:
Flourishing chemosynthetic life at the greatest depths of hadal trenches

The discovery of chemosynthesis-based benthic communities at depths of 5,800 m to 9,533 m in the Kuril–Kamchatka and western Aleutian trenches challenges traditional perspectives on the energy sources sustaining hadal fauna.

  • Xiaotong Peng
  • Mengran Du
  • Andrey V. Adrianov
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Repurposing haemoproteins for asymmetric metal-catalysed H atom transfer
elements.contents:
Repurposing haemoproteins for asymmetric metal-catalysed H atom transfer

Cytochrome P450 enzymes can be repurposed to catalyse asymmetric metal–hydride hydrogen atom transfer, a new-to-nature reaction.

  • Xiang Zhang
  • Dongping Chen
  • Thomas R. Ward
Article30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Remodelling of corticostriatal axonal boutons during motor learning
elements.contents:
Remodelling of corticostriatal axonal boutons during motor learning

Individual boutons on mouse corticostriatal axons exhibit differential selectivity for rewarded and unrewarded movements during motor learning, and the proportion of reward-responsive boutons increases.

  • Mengjun Sheng
  • Di Lu
  • Jun B. Ding
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Synthesis of bulk hexagonal diamond
elements.contents:
Synthesis of bulk hexagonal diamond

The synthesis, recovery and detailed characterization of bulk hexagonal diamond under high pressure and temperature conditions using precursor graphite carbon is described, demonstrating the first successful synthesis in the 100 µm to millimetre size range.

  • Liuxiang Yang
  • Kah Chun Lau
  • Ho-kwang Mao
Article30 Jul 2025

elements.title: A hypothalamic circuit that modulates feeding and parenting behaviours
elements.contents:
A hypothalamic circuit that modulates feeding and parenting behaviours

Single-cell transcriptomic analysis of mouse hypothalamus and behavioural experiments show that specific hypothalamic networks regulate conflicting feeding versus parenting behaviours of female mice.

  • Ivan C. Alcantara
  • Chia Li
  • Michael J. Krashes
Article30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Programmable protein ligation on cell surfaces
elements.contents:
Programmable protein ligation on cell surfaces

A synthetic biology system called SMART has been developed that uses conditional protein splicing for the programmable ligation of functional proteins from previously defined molecular combinations on cell surfaces.

  • Christian Kofoed
  • Girum Erkalo
  • Tom W. Muir
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Direct observation of coherent elastic antineutrino–nucleus scattering
elements.contents:
Direct observation of coherent elastic antineutrino–nucleus scattering

Direct observation of coherent elastic neutrino–nucleus scattering is reported using the data from the CONUS+ experiment in which the antineutrinos with energy less than 10 MeV are produced in a nuclear reactor.

  • N. Ackermann
  • H. Bonet
  • J. Woenckhaus
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Invariance of dynamo action in an early-Earth model
elements.contents:
Invariance of dynamo action in an early-Earth model

Early-Earth geometry models are presented, producing magnetic field intensity and morphologies agreeing with palaeomagnetic data in the deep past and demonstrating the negligible role of fluid viscosity in the Earth’s early geodynamo.

  • Yufeng Lin
  • Philippe Marti
  • Andrew Jackson
Article30 Jul 2025

elements.title: ACLY inhibition promotes tumour immunity and suppresses liver cancer
elements.contents:
ACLY inhibition promotes tumour immunity and suppresses liver cancer

Using metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis-driven hepatocellular carcinoma mouse models, an ATP citrate lyase inhibitor reduces tumour burden and enhances efficacy of current standards of care.

  • Jaya Gautam
  • Jianhan Wu
  • Gregory R. Steinberg
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Respiratory viral infections awaken metastatic breast cancer cells in lungs
elements.contents:
Respiratory viral infections awaken metastatic breast cancer cells in lungs

Mouse models show that respiratory infections from viruses such as influenza and SARS-CoV-2 can trigger metastasis of dormant breast cancer cells in the lungs, a finding supported by epidemiological data from two large human cohorts.

  • Shi B. Chia
  • Bryan J. Johnson
  • James DeGregori
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Transient APC/C inactivation by mTOR boosts glycolysis during cell cycle entry
elements.contents:
Transient APC/C inactivation by mTOR boosts glycolysis during cell cycle entry

APC/C activity is transiently inhibited to generate a pulse of glycolysis that is required for mammalian cell cycle entry.

  • Debasish Paul
  • Derek L. Bolhuis
  • Steven D. Cappell
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: A molecular cell atlas of mouse lemur, an emerging model primate
elements.contents:
A molecular cell atlas of mouse lemur, an emerging model primate

Together with a companion paper, the generation of a transcriptomic atlas for the mouse lemur and analyses of example cell types establish this animal as a molecularly tractable primate model organism.

  • Antoine de Morree
  • Iwijn De Vlaminck
  • Mark A. Krasnow
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Determinants of successful AAV-vectored delivery of HIV-1 bNAbs in early life
elements.contents:
Determinants of successful AAV-vectored delivery of HIV-1 bNAbs in early life

A single dose of an adeno-associated virus vector encoding an HIV-1 broadly neutralizing antibody given shortly after birth results in persistent antibody expression and protection from infection in rhesus macaque models of human HIV-1 transmission through breastfeeding and sexual intercourse.

  • Amir Ardeshir
  • Daniel O’Hagan
  • Mauricio A. Martins
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Diffusing protein binders to intrinsically disordered proteins
elements.contents:
Diffusing protein binders to intrinsically disordered proteins

Using RFdiffusion, a general method for targeting intrinsically disordered proteins and regions for protein design has been developed.

  • Caixuan Liu
  • Kejia Wu
  • David Baker
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Tropical response to ocean circulation slowdown raises future drought risk
elements.contents:
Tropical response to ocean circulation slowdown raises future drought risk

An Atlantic meridional overturning circulation slowdown drives widespread shifts in tropical rainfall through the propagation of high-latitude cooling into the tropical North Atlantic.

  • Pedro N. DiNezio
  • Timothy M. Shanahan
  • Xu Zhang
Article30 Jul 2025

elements.title: SuFEx-based antitubercular compound irreversibly inhibits Pks13
elements.contents:
SuFEx-based antitubercular compound irreversibly inhibits Pks13

A preclinical covalent compound, CMX410, contains a aryl fluorosulfate warhead that targets the acyltransferase domain of Mtb Pks13, an essential enzyme in cell-wall biosynthesis, making it a promising candidate for tuberculosis treatment regimens.

  • Inna V. Krieger
  • Paridhi Sukheja
  • Case W. McNamara
Article30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Design of highly functional genome editors by modelling CRISPR–Cas sequences
elements.contents:
Design of highly functional genome editors by modelling CRISPR–Cas sequences

Gene editors designed using artificial intelligence can undertake precision editing of the human genome.

  • Jeffrey A. Ruffolo
  • Stephen Nayfach
  • Ali Madani
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025

elements.title: Mouse lemur cell atlas informs primate genes, physiology and disease
elements.contents:
Mouse lemur cell atlas informs primate genes, physiology and disease

Together with an accompanying paper presenting a transcriptomic atlas of the mouse lemur, interrogation of the atlas provides a rich body of data to support the use of the organism as a model for primate biology and health.

  • Camille Ezran
  • Shixuan Liu
  • Mark A. Krasnow
ArticleOpen Access30 Jul 2025
